Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount the student needs as determined under subsection 12(2) of the Act, and

Subsection.Text: The Minister, an appropriate authority or a body authorized by the Minister for a province may make a grant for students with dependants to a qualifying student who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is qualified for enrolment or is enrolled as a full-time student;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has one or more dependants;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 12(1)(a) and (b) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is not denied further student loans under section 15; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has a total family income from the previous year that is no more than the applicable income threshold set out in Table 1 of Schedule 3.

Subsection.Text: The grant shall be $200 for each dependant for each month of study.
The Minister, an appropriate authority or a body authorized by the Minister for a province may make a grant for students with dependants to a qualifying student who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is qualified for enrolment or is enrolled as a part-time student;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has one or more dependants;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: needs an amount as determined under subsection 12(2) of the Act in excess of the aggregate of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the maximum amount payable to the student under subsection 38(3), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the greater of $4,000 less the aggregate principal amount of all outstanding part-time loans and 0;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 12(1)(a) and (b) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is not denied further student loans under section 15; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: has an annual family income that is no more than the applicable income threshold set out in Table 1 of Schedule 3.

Subsection.Text: The grant for each loan year shall not exceed the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount the qualifying student needs as determined under subsection 12(2) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $40 per week of study in a loan year if the student has one or two dependants,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $60 per week of study in a loan year if the student has three or more dependants, and

Heading.TitleText: Grant for Students with Permanent Disabilities

Subsection.Text: The Minister, an appropriate authority or a body authorized by the Minister for a province may make a grant for students with permanent disabilities to a qualifying student who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a permanent disability;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 12(1)(a) and (b) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not denied further student loans under section 15.

Subsection.Text: The qualifying student shall provide, with their loan application, proof of their permanent disability in the form of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a medical certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a psycho-educational assessment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: documentation proving receipt of federal or provincial disability assistance.

Subsection.Text: The grant for a loan year shall be $2,000.
The Minister, an appropriate authority or a body authorized by the Minister for a province may make a grant to a qualifying student who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is qualified for enrolment or is enrolled as a full-time student in a program of studies of at least two years’ duration that leads to a degree, certificate or diploma not beyond the undergraduate level;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 12(1)(a) and (b) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not denied further student loans under section 15.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of the grant for each month of study shall be the lesser of $375 and the amount determined by the following formula:

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the result obtained by subtracting the applicable income threshold set out in column 2 of Schedule 4 from the amount of the student’s total family income from the previous year, and
is the applicable figure set out in column 3 of Schedule 4.

Subsection.Text: Beginning in 2018, the threshold amounts in column 2 of Schedule 4 shall be adjusted annually on August 1 by the annual percentage increase to the Consumer Price Index for the previous calendar year. The resulting threshold amounts rounded to the nearest dollar apply during that loan year.

If the amount determined in subsection (3) is less than the value applicable for the previous loan year, no adjustment is to be made to the thresholds applicable for that loan year and the thresholds applicable for the preceding loan year continue to apply for that loan year.
For the purpose of subsection (3), the Consumer Price Index is the annual all-items Consumer Price Index for Canada published by Statistics Canada.
The Minister, an appropriate authority or a body authorized by the Minister for a province may make a transition grant with respect to a qualifying student who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 12(1)(a) and (b) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not denied further loans under section 15;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: received a Millennium Bursary for the 2008–2009 school year and has not ceased since that year to be a full-time student under section 8;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has received no more than $25,000, in the aggregate, of grants under this section, sections 40.02 and 40.021, and Canada Millennium Scholarships other than awards under the Millennium Excellence Awards Program;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has received the grants under this section, the grants referred to in sections 40.02 and 40.021 and Canada Millennium Scholarships other than awards under the Millennium Excellence Awards Program, in respect of no more than 32 months of study; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: has received the grant for no more than three consecutive loan years.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the grant for a loan year shall be the amount that the student received as a Millennium Bursary in the 2008–2009 school year minus any amount that the student is entitled to receive under section 40.02 or 40.021 for that loan year.

In this section, Millennium Bursary means a bursary awarded under the Millennium Bursary Program other than a Millennium Access Bursary, awards under the Millennium Excellence Awards Program and scholarships awarded under the World Petroleum Council Millennium Scholarship Program.

The Minister shall pay to the appropriate authority or other body authorized by the Minister for a province the amount that the authority or other body requires to make Canada student grants to qualifying students for a loan year under this Part.

Each appropriate authority or other body shall provide to the Minister at the end of each loan year, or on request of the Minister during a loan year, an accounting of all grants made to qualifying students by that appropriate authority or other body during that loan year or other period identified by the Minister.

An appropriate authority or other body shall repay to the Minister any money provided for a loan year that is not given as grants in accordance with this Part. The overpayment becomes a debt due to Her Majesty in right of Canada on the day after the last day of that loan year.
The Minister may, by written notice, require a person to repay all or part of a grant, other than a grant awarded under section 34 or 40.022, to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is no longer qualified for enrolment or is no longer enrolled as a full-time student or a part-time student, as the case may be, within 30 days after the first day of class unless unforeseen and unavoidable circumstances beyond the control of the person caused that change in status;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person received the grant on the basis of providing inaccurate information or of failing to provide relevant information to the Minister, the appropriate authority or the body authorized by the Minister for a province; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the appropriate authority determines that the person was not entitled to the grant as the result of a reassessment of the person’s need as determined under subsection 12(2) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the grant that is required to be repaid shall be converted into a direct loan.

The Minister may, based on documentary evidence provided within six months after the date of notice of the requirement, cancel or amend a requirement for repayment made under paragraph (1)(a) if the requirement is not justified under that paragraph.
Subject to subsection (2), for the purposes of paragraphs 17.1(1)(a), (b), (d), (f) and (g) of the Act, the prescribed period is as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount of assistance awarded in excess of the amount to which the person would have otherwise been entitled is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than $4,000, one year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: $4,000 or more but less than $6,000, two years,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: $6,000 or more but less than $8,000, three years,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: $8,000 or more but less than $10,000, four years, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: $10,000 or more, five years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is not a qualifying student, five years; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if administrative measures have already been taken in respect of the person under section 17.1 of the Act or section 18.1 of the Canada Student Loans Act, five years.

Subsection.Text: If more than one period applies to the person under subsection (1), the prescribed period is the longest applicable period.

Where the Minister makes a payment to a lender pursuant to subparagraph 5(a)(viii) or (ix) of the Act in respect of a risk-shared loan, Her Majesty in right of Canada is subrogated in and to all the rights of the lender in respect of the risk-shared loan and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, all rights and powers of the lender in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the risk-shared loan;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any judgment obtained by the lender in respect of the risk-shared loan; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any security held by the lender for the repayment of the risk-shared loan.

Subsection.Text: Her Majesty in right of Canada is entitled to exercise all the rights, powers and privileges that the lender had or may exercise in respect of the loan, judgment or security, including the right to commence or continue any action or proceeding, to execute any release, transfer, sale or assignment, or in any way collect, realize or enforce the loan, judgment or security.
